attributes.action: free prescriptions to people between 60 and 65 yrs old is wrong
attributes.background: concern for the funding of the NHS

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear a helmet over 10 years old
attributes.background:
experts within the helmet industry such as Arai, and Shoei. have said that you should change your helmet every 5-7 years.
this is due to the degrading of the polystrene within the helmet, That is the most crucial bit as thats the part that saves you life!

attributes.action: request that the government consider 'rewilding' Britain to help save ecosystems
attributes.background: many animals that are now extinct or endangered in this country have been proven to greatly improve the countryside of other countries, such as beavers being effective flood defenders. to restore the natural balance in our ecosystems, the government should consider proposals from Rewilding Britain.
attributes.additional_details: some of the animals considered to be reintroduced are: lynx, beaver, boar, pine martens, many species of birds such as hawks, eagles and owls, marine life including whales and even wolves and bears, although the proposed introduction of these would require consultation with local residents due to ill-deserved stigma and perceived danger (top predators like these usually leave humans alone). when introduced, these animals should be under protection by law from hunting and destruction of habitats.

attributes.action: Lower  the pension  age to 60  for disabled people
attributes.background: Why make the disable  wait for there pension  until there 65/66  they should have a choice  to retire at 60 or wait until they are 65/66

attributes.action: Make apprenticeships available to people from the age of 12
attributes.background: School doesn't work for everyone. However it might be beneficial for some people to learn in different ways through an apprenticeship. This might help young people with autism or other similar needs who want to learn but can't be in school.

attributes.action: Stop the eyesight test for the driving practical test.
attributes.background: For anyone going to be doing their driving test or is doing it, I think the eyesight test should not be in place. As long as we can see clearly that's all that matters, I don't see the point in having to read a number plate at a distance. Sign this petition help get the eyesight test removed
attributes.additional_details:
Well for those who fail and keep failing their driving test. if we fail so many times then get a refund. I have failed a few times and still booking for more.

Would be fair if we are able to get a refund for the driving test booking fee if we fail 3 times.

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background: As many people my age from 18-21, it's ridiculous that the government expect for a household income to have a link between my financial status and a household income, and a greater majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this needs to be re-looked at and this is not not blindlessly asking for more money for everyone but letting those who need help and work hard for themselves with no financial help not struggle!

attributes.action: Sociology should be taught across all key stages, starting from primary school
attributes.background: Sociology is fundamental in understanding our social world, and this gives the opportunity to develop critical thinking skills.This is a positive thing, as people can share their views and in doing this, improving society. Sociology is important as it explains our functioning in daily life.
attributes.additional_details: 'I had always looked down on sociology as this arriviste discipline. It didn't have the noble history of English and history as a subject. But once I had a little exposure to it, I said, 'Hey, here's the key. Here's the key to understanding life and all its forms.' Tom Wolfe

attributes.action: Use 2% of the UK's budget to help aid refugees affected by the Syrian war.
attributes.background: Currently, the Syrian war is forcing millions of refugees to flee to Europe for aid. I believe that if we are to become a peaceful world and allow society to advance in a prosperous way, we need to stop allowing stereotypical racism and fear to kill millions of suffering people.
attributes.additional_details: They are not here to steal jobs they want to be back in Syria but it's too unsafe. We need to make the country understand that these are people! Not statistics or terrorists! Just imagine if we were in the same situation.

attributes.action: Build a link road connecting the M54 to the M6 Toll bypassing Featherstone
attributes.background: The advantages of using the M6 Toll can be negated by delays caused by congestion in Featherstone
attributes.additional_details: The road through Featherstone must produce very excessive pollution to those living along it and it must be dreadful driving in and out of those premises

attributes.action: Introduce Targeted Sanctions and Travel bans on President Trump and Inner Circle
attributes.background: President Donald Trump is breaching the US constitution, ignoring judicial orders breaking international law and separating families with his executive order revoking visas and has fired the acting Attorney General for refusing to defend an unconstitutional position.
attributes.additional_details:
Targeted sanctions similar to those applied to senior Russian leaders can be used to pressure US leadership to return from the brink of fascism before it is too late. It is important to stand early against tyrants before they can remove democratic checks and balances and the UK needs a democratic USA as ally.

People included in the sanctions should at least include the President, his children, VP, Steven Bannon, the US Cabinet and nominees and the immediate families of all those mentioned.

attributes.action: Have reciprocal laws for countries that do not allow property purchases
attributes.background:
Countries such as Thailand, Mexico, Hong Kong, Malaysia, all have rules that limit what a foreigner can buy or own in the terms of property and land. Yet in the UK, people from these countries can buy land or property with zero problems.
Its time that the UK government passed reciprocal laws.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.macleans.ca/economy/economicanalysis/how-the-rest-of-the-world-limits-foreign-home-buyers/

http://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/foreign-property-buyers-in-australia-face-sweeping-crackdown/news-story/21794ae0b79f2b46040bc3e5a4a7b0db

http://www.china.org.cn/english/LivinginChina/220516.htm

https://www.justlanded.com/english/Thailand/Thailand-Guide/Property/Legal-restrictions

attributes.action: Stop penalising ex Veterens on their war pensions.
attributes.background: I want the government to stop penalising ex veterans who claim a war pension, but have to surrender most of it because they are out of work and claim benefits.

attributes.action: Exempt Landlords from Stamp Duty if let to a local authority or Housing Trust
attributes.background:
Growing shortage of affordable property to rent.

Incentivise Landlords to rent to the public sector for a minimum of 5 years below market rates, in return for tax and duty relief.

Also introduce enhanced Interest Relief for long term Landlords committing to a 10 year or more investment term.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp Duty & the reduction in interest relief has made investment in residential property much less favourable, the result, less investment in BuytoLet (BTL) properties and landlords have been selling existing stock ahead of the changes.

This reduction in stock and the high demand, will inevitably lead to  rent increases.

Incentivise investment by exempting Stamp Duty on all property let to the public sector for a 5 years term, long term landlords should benefit from enhanced interest relief

attributes.action: To define marriage as exclusively only between one man and one woman.
attributes.background: The definition of marriage by the UK parliament should be the traditional definition of One Man and One Woman, nothing else, and should be taught as such in the education system.
attributes.additional_details: 1611 KJV Bible

attributes.action: Increase UK Summer School Holidays By at Least 1-2 weeks
attributes.background: We don't get long enough holidays but schools and local authorities feel they have the need to fine us just because we leave school at least a week early. I understand education Is vital, but at least let us leave school for the summer as soon as we have finished our final exams.
attributes.additional_details: With all respect i believe it is very unfair, in the summer i would like to be seeing my family abroad not doing exams 3 weeks early then just doing nothing at school. Most Countries Including America get like 3 month holidays i am not asking for that. I am just asking for you to consider my request that we can leave school for the holidays as soon as we finish our exams. However, I understand that in some occasions it may not be possible, but i am asking you to please consider this.

attributes.action: Exempt charge of £30(min)for letter to Unis from GPs re health of applicants.
attributes.background: Daughter has applied to Universities who requested letter from GP regarding her health. Local surgery have insisted on a payment of £30 claiming this is a NON-NHS service (apparently charges £30-55). How come a 'sick note' non chargeable to adults but students need to pay for a simple letter?
attributes.additional_details: The GP surgery required a payment of £30.  When questioned the Assistant Practice Manager advised that payment was in line with Government guidelines of £30- 55.  Personally think this is outrageous given students now required to pay for education and this is another hidden cost to any student wanting to go to Uni (costs of which are prohibitive to most).

attributes.action: A real Home automatically for every Ex Servicemen.
attributes.background: Servicemen are being discharged to find themselves on the streets. Having to live on the streets and beg to survive. They have served their country and our country needs to show respect for them.......
attributes.additional_details: Everyday housing is given to immigrants who have never contributed to our country either through taxes or national insurance. Yet our servicemen are being treated like 2nd class citizens having to sleep on the streets and beg .......

attributes.action: Reform the public broadcasting licensing law.
attributes.background:
At the moment you cannot listen to a radio or play your own music in your place of work without a public broadcasting license. This includes in your own home if you are working from there. 

The current law isn't in the spirit of its intent, which is to require a media company to get a license.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.ppluk.com/

attributes.action: Create independent organisations to run the NHS and Education
attributes.background: The NHS and Education are perpetual footballs for politicians.  They see them as their way of "making policy" and "changing Britain".  In the same way as was done with the Bank of England, both the NHS and Education should be taken out of politics, and run by independent, expert organisations.
attributes.additional_details: Let's stop perpetual political reforms of the NHS and Education in the UK, and create stability.  Let's also stop politicians who have zero experience in health or education from making policy, and leave instead trust these tasks to panels of experts.  Only this way can be bring stability to, and take forward, our beloved organisations.

attributes.action: Abolish the 5% VAT on children's car seats
attributes.background: Currently, the VAT on children’s car seats is at the reduced rate of 5%. However, by law children must use a car seat until they’re 12 years old or 135 centimetres tall (whichever comes first).
attributes.additional_details: It seems ridiculous to apply VAT to something when doing so could potentially result in parents compromising on their child's safety. If children's clothing is zero-rated then car seats for children and babies should be too.

attributes.action: refunds should be given for bets placed on non starters
attributes.background: many punters are losing out in singles doubles trebles fc/tc. placepots etc. I and the majority if not all punters would like a refund if a horse refuses to start the race. It is wrong at the highest level. we don't want a free bet where you don't get your stake back. we just want refunded.
attributes.additional_details: 3.10 Newcastle 23 January 2017 horse Bigirononhiship failed to start. no run for my money I lost single and fc bet placed.

attributes.action: Road improvements to dual carriageway between Polegate to Lewis
attributes.background: With the increased housing developments in and around Eastbourne and Polegate causing more traffic congestion along the A27 between Polegate to Lewis it's now time to dual carriageway this section of road

attributes.action: be able to self-exclude from book makers and casinos for more then a year
attributes.background: I know from experience and self banning use to be five years now it's only one year and that's not enough we should at least have a right to choose how long we can ban ourselves for.

attributes.action:
1.Importance of voters age of 50 years and above.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.
attributes.background: I used to study in UK  .As a foreigner it felt so good that something which British citizens (locals) were voting and i as a foreigner was also voting.That showed me the importance,responsibility and equity in that very moment about voting.
attributes.additional_details:
1.Considering double the votes for elections only for those voters above the age of 50 years.As elders know the best to choose and by doing so it will encourage the young generation to vote and also to choose wisely and the best for the nation.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.There should be proper knowledge provided to the students in schools & colleges about what the votes are and what are the benefits to vote for themselves and for the nation.

attributes.action: £1pw contribution to help fund NHS by ALL adults irrespective of age and income
attributes.background: I propose an idea to help fund our beloved NHS and Care Services  before they collapse under the pressure. A compulsory contribution of £1pw from all adults, controversially regardless of age and income. This would raise around 2.6b a year.
attributes.additional_details: I have calculated £2.6b a year by using the simple calculation of approx 50m adults (over 16) in UK x £1 = £50m x 52 wks = £2.600.000.000. 16 would be the starting age if not in education. For this to work I believe everyone needs to contribute. It would be easy to start excluding people because of age and income etc but this would put a greater financial burden on fewer people who would resist the charges. The NHS is freely available to all, so a small weekly contribution of £1 seems fair.

attributes.action: Change the Discretionary Payment income cap.
attributes.background: The discriminatory payment income cap is much too low. A disabled family on all appropriate benefits falls much higher in income bracket to the aloud £15,000. This is discrimination against severely disabled families, as these people  successfully applied for community care grants and crisis loans.
attributes.additional_details: I myself have spoken to a member of the staff at the Discretionary Payment office and was refused a grant on the basis that my income was too high. The reason for my income being so high was not because of work or anything of the like, was simply because my daughter is so severely disabled and on high rate DLA that she was also entitled to disability component of child tax credit's. That entitlement to the disability component of child tax credit's is what put my and come over.  Discrimination.

attributes.action: Professionals completing babies checks, to screen mums for PND during 1st year
attributes.background: I am a mum of two children. I suffered PND with my second child. I had been to gp before birth but was told too close to birth to be given medication. I was then left and not checked. 14wks post birth I was in a really dark, scary place. Had it been checked during those 1st weeks id had gotten help

attributes.action: Zero tax for 18-21 year olds in education and part time working
attributes.background: People between the age of 18 and 21 can't afford to pay tax on a part time job and don't have enough time for a full time job while in education.

attributes.action: Prevent terrorist lorry attacks using temporary concrete stanchions.
attributes.background: Temporary concrete stanchions at public events and locations prevent terrorist lorry attacks. All UK locations where significant numbers of people are gathered in small spaces must be temporarily or permanently protected by suitable lorry stopping devices.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36806691 This is established technology - after the attack in Berlin these devices were deployed, they should have been deployed beforehand. To not do so is pure ignorance. The argument that they are an eyesore is invalid, you can dress them up like Santa or Snowmen. Whatever is in keeping with the event.

attributes.action: When referring to our Debt state what we owe not what % it is of something else.
attributes.background: Since 1947 our Debt increased from £25 bn to £1,547 bn but when compared to GDP it allows Gov to conceal from us their out of control spending and borrowing of more than £2 bn every week for 10 years. For more alarming facts about the way Gov run our Country see www.mrms.uk
attributes.additional_details: A debt is “a sum of money owed” and should be referred to as such. There is no logical reason why Government should compare our National Debt to GDP (or anything else) other than to keep the truth from us of their out of control spending and borrowing.

attributes.action: Reading Prison as an Enterprise Zone for new Businesses.
attributes.background: This petition proposes the multiuse development of Reading Prison. The Grade II-listed building would be used as a ‘Business Incubator’ where start-up companies share communal infrastructure but operate within a designated space themselves. The remaining site would be a residential development.
attributes.additional_details:
This site is perfect for new businesses, with access to the station as well as supporting industries in the surrounding area.
Existing centres of innovation (The University and Business parks) could be sources of collaboration.
Ernst and Young forecasts Reading to be the fastest growing local economy in the UK, making this a pivotal moment in Reading's economic future.
The prison site will enable a diverse range of new businesses to develop, further spreading Reading’s prosperity.

attributes.action: Criminal Justice System to accept polygraph results as evidence.
attributes.background: For serious offences a Polygraph test should be used as evidence. For crimes such as historic child abuse where independent witnesses will not really exist. As nearly all children who are abused will by themselves. These results should be used or funding for research should be given.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the results to be used or funding granted to make these tests more accurate. 
 
Some people believe that the lie detectors are 90% accurate when other believe they are around 70% accurate. http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=92847

When eyewitness statements are used as evidence and their accuracy can be within this %.

What we want is some form of lie detector to be used in the near future as evidence.

attributes.action: The Jury Should be Scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel that the jury should be scrapped due to the impact that the decision will have on the persons life. If the ECJ doesn't use a jury, why should other courts.

attributes.action: Protect pension funds by changing the law governing distributions by companies
attributes.background:
Companies Act 2006 fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous for personal gain

Signing this petition may be your best chance to secure the financial future of your company’s pension fund and your life in retirement.
attributes.additional_details:
Accumulative distributable reserves brought forward should be used to cover the pension fund deficit first before further distributions. 

Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.

Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and remain with the company.

Read more at the-empty-chair(dot)com

attributes.action: Introduce plain bottles for alcoholic drinks to discourage drinking.
attributes.background: The government decision to introduce plain packaging for cigarettes while leaving alcoholic brands to market their poison in fancy bottles is hypocrisy. Correct this mistake by forcing them too to get rid of their marketing. If the government is interested in saving people's health, this is obvious.
attributes.additional_details: One does not need to Google for long to find that alcohol is the nation's biggest killer, that it - especially in this season - severely strains out emergency response teams and is highly addictive. Not advocating prohibition of any substance, but it is simply not right to villify one drug while leaving another untouched. I cannot imagine how anyone can justify such a move with a clear consciousness.

attributes.action: Make mansard and loft extensions permitted development in non-conservation areas
attributes.background: Mansard and loft extensions for terrace properties require planning permission.  This gives local authorities the power to refuse on design ground even when there is no objections from local residents.  These type of extensions should be automatically permitted except in conservation areas.

attributes.action: When selecting route for HS3 include Manchester to carlisle.
attributes.background: HS2 is meant to provide a link from the North to the south. A full upgrade of the UK railway network is required to reach the actual North of England carlisle  in place of targeted more advanced areas where spending is already in place.

attributes.action: Make 16+ Zip Oyster cards a form of legal age identification for purchases.
attributes.background: Isn't it annoying going to the cinema and being turned away because you don't have any "accepted ID" on you? Trying to buy lottery tickets for your family? It isn't right that to be able to do these things, you have to carry your passport around, when there's a perfectly good ZIP card in your pocket

attributes.action: Do not ban fireworks to the public but increase the age of sale to 25 minimum.
attributes.background: Thousands of people respectively enjoy garden fireworks and use them accordingly, why should the whole nation have that taken away from them because of a few peoples irresponsible use of fireworks? It's not fair that everyone should pay because of a few.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks have been used since the 12th century, animals and people have coped fine, animal owners have information widely available to them to help their animals cope. Lifting the age of sale to 25 will help stop the irresponsible use of fireworks. It is simply not fair to spoil it for everyone because of a few!

attributes.action: Make it a legal obligation to have a mobile phone holder/mount fitted in cars.
attributes.background: It should be a legal obligation to have a phone dock, holder or mount fitted in your car to pass an MOT. It is illegal to have your phone in your hand while driving but for most, unfortunately it continues to be a problem. We hope to reduce the deaths associated with mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.additional_details: A recent video showed a lorry driver crashing into a line of cars, including one full of a family, because he was on his phone. He would not have taken his eyes off the road if he had had his mobile phone in a mount. It is devastating what has happened to this family, but for the driver as well. All he did was something that Everyone does at one time or another and he was unlucky. A family were killed instantly, this could have been avoided.

attributes.action: change the law on websites listing companies without the owners permission
attributes.background: Parliament needs to change the law on how websites list companies without the company owners permission. It should be up to the business owner to decide where and how their business is displayed and advertised, and be removed from any website at the owners request.

attributes.action: Mandatory Client Money Protection for Letting Agents
attributes.background: The Government is less than lukewarm about making it mandatory that all Landlord and Tenant money is safely held in Client Accounts and covered by insurance policies. Some of our present Landlords have lost thousands with agents that have closed down and run off with money they banked from Tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
A solicitor, conveyancer or even a financial adviser is not afforded the same trust. Unfortunately the small minority of agents do, often, run away with large sums of money!

Why are we as agents so poorly regulated?

Further discussion and details here: https://www.aaronjbarclay.co.uk/should-client-money-protection-be-mandatory. Estate agents in London and beyond should be made to comply.

Please sign if you feel this is a worthy petition.

attributes.action: All telecoms personnel in the UK should be licensed
attributes.background: I have experienced poor service from a telecoms provider, which resulted in me being given 2.6-2.8 Mb when 10-15Mb was freely available at my home. People who work in the telecoms industry have a great deal of power, and should be licensed and checked before they can work.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered over the years with a controlled censorship on my business lines resulting in call drop outs at an alarming rate,  yet when I called the 1471 service 99.9% of these callers were unavailable which I find very odd. Yet friends and family and established clients have no problems contacting me. The present system is out of date and Ofcom needs more power to regulate the industry. Security is a major problem - there are 2000 calls a day to Action Fraud.
